alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Big Lost Highlands, Copper Basin; Eastern Magic Valley; Lost River Range; Lost River Valleys; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Sun Valley Region; Upper Snake River Plain; Wood River Foothills (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 3:53PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS LIFTING NORTH INTO THE SNAKE RIVER PLAIN AND EASTERN MAGIC VALLEY THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 350 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms extending from 12 miles southeast of Richfield to 17 miles west of Aberdeen to near American Falls, moving north at 30 mph. A landspout was observed near American Falls earlier as the line spread out into the Snake River Plain. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts to 45 mph, pea size hail, and blowing dust. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... American Falls, Arco, Carey, Neeley, Little Wood Reservoir, Picabo, American Falls Reservoir, Aberdeen, Atomic City, Craters Of The Moon, Gannett, Central Inl, Taber, Southwest Inl, Springfield, Butte City, Sterling, East Butte, Garfield Ranger Station and Big Southern Butte. LANDSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
